history.content:
127 is more linear algebra (linear optimizations), while 126 goes deeper into probability. IIRC Sahai recommended 126 if you only can take one of them, assuming you took ee16ab, since those also go into optimizations.

---

126 is probability theory and stochastic processes. 127 is convex optimization. Both are really really difficult; I'd recommend 126 if you can only take one of them assuming you've done the necessary ee16a/b/cs70/math53 background.

---

They're fundamentally different classes, as other people have said. 126 is the recommendation over 127.

127 is more linear algebra (linear optimizations), while 126 goes deeper into probability. IIRC Sahai recommended 126 if you only can take one of them, assuming you took ee16ab, since those also go into optimizations.

---

126 is probability theory and stochastic processes. 127 is convex optimization. Both are really really difficult; I'd recommend 126 if you can only take one of them assuming you've done the necessary ee16a/b/cs70/math53 background.

127 is more linear algebra (linear optimizations), while 126 goes deeper into probability. IIRC Sahai recommended 126 if you only can take one of them, assuming you took ee16ab, since those also go into optimizations.

Could someone speak to the differences between these two? They are usually recommended for 189 but what are the specifics of each course/what do they emphasize? If I only have space to take one before 189 is there one you would recommend and why?

Thanks!
history.subject: EECS 126 vs EECS 127
